I have gotten this as well on N20060418.  It happened on a workspace that was last touched in M6.  I hadn't done much in this session beyond stress some navigation key bindings such as ctrl-f6, f7, and f8.
*** Bug 136933 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I also had this error today while shutting down, using N20060419-0840 on Linux GTK.  I was also using a workspace that hadn't been used for several weeks.  The error did not recur on a subsequent shutdown.

Just got it again, same conditions as described in bug 136933. 
In my case, this was always my daily dev workspace (as opposed to a random old one). Build id: N20060419-0840

My trace looks slightly different though... will paste it in case it rings any bell.

Clients can set a message into the status line containing an image but we can't control their image's life-cycle during shutdown. 

Could we place an 'isDisposed' check in CLabel's 'getTotalSize'?
Veronika has straightened me out on this. I'll track down the culprit.

'Fixed' in >20060421.

This fix wires off the symptom (which was the PerspectiveSwitcher causing a layout during shutdown). There are now no layouts performed on shutdown so this particular manifestation is no longer possible.

I've opened bug 137963 to track what I -think- was the original issue...
